name: Polka Dot Begonia
description: Begonia maculata, commonly known as Polka Dot Begonia or Spotted Begonia, is a terrestrial plant native to tropical regions of Brazil, particularly the Atlantic Forest. It belongs to the Begoniaceae family and features upright, cane-like stems (60-120 cm tall) with large, asymmetrical, dark green leaves with distinctive white polka dot spots on the upper surface and red undersides. The plant displays an upright, bushy growth habit. Leaves often feature striking patterns including spirals, spots, stripes, and iridescent sheens, with some species having translucent "windows" in their leaves. Adapted to tropical climates with high humidity, consistent warmth, and filtered light conditions. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty with its distinctive spotted foliage. It's extremely popular among Begonia enthusiasts for its attractive polka dot pattern.
careTips: Keep soil moist but not soggy
Bright indirect light - avoid direct sun
